block.p: ADIDAS-SALOMON A.G., New York, named Ross McMullin president at its North American unit, succeeding Steve Wynne, who left as president and chief executive in January. Mr. McMullin had most recently been president at the Central Europe Group of Gillette.
BARCLAYS, London, named David Roberts, managing director for markets and solutions, chief executive of a new business banking unit specializing in services for small and midsize companies.

ADIDAS-SALOMON A.G., New York, named Ross McMullin president at its North American unit, succeeding Steve Wynne, who left as president and chief executive in January. Mr. McMullin had most recently been president at the Central Europe Group of Gillette.
BARCLAYS, London, named David Roberts, managing director for markets and solutions, chief executive of a new business banking unit specializing in services for small and midsize companies.
JOBS.COM, Dallas, named Peter A. Gudmundsson president and chief executive, succeeding Timothy Armes. Mr. Gudmundsson had been president at Primedia Workplace Learning.
MARSH & MCLENNAN COS., New York, named Jeffrey W. Greenberg, president and chief executive, to the post of chairman. He succeeds A. J. C. Smith, who is retiring.

STATE STREET CORP., Boston, named David A. Spina, president, to the post of chief executive, succeeding Marshall Carter, who is retiring. Mr. Carter remains chairman until Jan. 2001, when Mr. Spina will add that title as well.
WILLIAMS-SONOMA, San Francisco, named Gary Friedman, president of the retail division and chief merchandising officer, to the vacant post of president.
